revised_title: Tensile Properties and Fracture Behavior of Aluminum-Zinc Alloy Crystals
tldr: This study investigates the tensile properties and fracture behavior of aluminum-zinc alloy crystals. The authors found that as the zinc content increases, the amount of extension before fracture decreases. The alloys exhibit a yield point and tend to fracture in a single plane. The study also discusses the distortion measurements and the relation between the plane of fracture and the crystal structure.
